raw_text: Our multi-sieve approach isdifferent from (Raghunathan et al 2010) in several respects: (a) our sieves are machine-learning classifiers, (b) the same pair of mentions can fall into multiple sieves, (c) later sieves can override the decisions made by earlier sieves, allowing to re cover from errors as additional evidence becomes available
